title: My bookmarks are missing and the Bookmark Toolbar doesn't work
content: I don't know whether this happened after an update - there was one a few days ago, but I only realised this morning, after switching on the computer, that all my bookmarks are missing. The toolbar is there, empty, only reading "For quick access, place your bookmarks here on the bookmarks toolbar"... I wish! I tried to restore the bookmarks - but it seems there is no backup to restore at all. Then I tried to check my profiles, but there is only the one currently in use. Then I tried to move a tab to the bookmarks toolbar - and nothing happened. Then I began to panic: toolbar apart, we're speaking about years of bookmarks, most of them related to my research for my books... All the advice in the support seems to point towards profiles and backups, but, as I said, it's clearly not my case... Please, please, please: help!

title: Starting today there's no CC on ABC.com
content:
Hello,

As my title says, there's no Closed Captioning available on ABC.com. It was working last night but tonight it's gone. It's only an issue on FF for Desktop. There's no problem on FF for Android and also no problem on Chrome for Desktop. There's no problem on any other video website like YouTube, Peacock, etc. It's just ABC.com. I tried restarting FF, reloading the website, clearing the cache, etc.

There have been quite a few FF (Desktop) updates over the past few days. There was even one first thing this morning before I tried watching something on ABC.com. I wonder if an update is causing this glitch.

Any ideas??

Thanks, Andre'a

title: sync doesn't bring back bookmarks and extensions
content: What is Mozilla synchronization for? If after formatting my PC, I can't bring my data from the previously installed Mozilla, it's hard to understand. I'm very disappointed. I lost more than 300 files saved in my favorites and specific extensions that I don't remember the name of anymore. If I synchronize my data, it's because I want them saved in the cloud for possible recovery. Just like any cell phone company, you connect your Google account, for example, so that if it's stolen, you lose your cell phone, etc., you have all your data saved in the Google cloud (remember, it's an example. There are other technology companies that do the same, Microsoft, Apple, Xiaomi, OneDrive, etc.), but you don't explain this. You just keep asking me to synchronize HEY SYNC YOUR DATA NOW!, and then when you need it most, you lose your favorites and extensions as if you were using the browser in incognito mode (where nothing is saved and you can't recover anything after formatting), any synchronization consumes some computer resources, but yours doesn't make any sense.

title: Export logins (passwords) creates a csv file that can't be password protected
content: I am evaluating a password manager application and exported my FF passwords and imported them into the app. For testing I removed all of the passwords from FF. I want to password protect the csv file rather than delete it in case I need to import the passwords back into FF. When I go to File/Info, the "Protect Workbook" option is greyed out. When I go to the "Review" tab, the option to "Protect Workbook" is available, not the "Unprotect" option, so the workbook is not protected. If I click on the "Share" folder on the right side of the ribbon, there is no "More" option. In Windows Explorer the file is on my desktop, not OneDrive - Personal. I right clicked on the file, selected "Give access to" and took the option to remove access. The File/Info option is still greyed out. How can I password protect this file or how can I export it in a format that can be imported later?
